card_data.description: Aegis, Endurance
card_data.name: Xulta Exile

ej.notes: Understatted 3 drop. Would be great with evasion built-in, but it requires another card (like a good weapon) to be any good really.

card_data.description: Give one of your units Overwhelm. Then give a unit, weapon, or spell in your hand Overwhelm.
card_data.name: Touch of Wild

ej.notes: It's probably the worst of the touch cycle, but is a win-con in a deck with the primal damage based board wipe. Also goes up a bit when paired with huge relic weapons like Shugo's Hooked Sword.

card_data.description: Overwhelm, Pledge
card_data.name: Inferno Zealot

ej.notes: Expensive Breath of Voprex on a stick?

card_data.description: At the start of your turn, sacrifice Emerald Maw to play an Emerald Incarnation with Attack/ Health equal to your Armor.
card_data.name: Emerald Maw

ej.notes: This has the potential to quickly convert itself into a nice big body, but it's triple influence brings it down a bit for me. If you're way behind it will at least gain you 9 life and if you are able to straight up protect it for a turn you get a giant unit out of the deal.

card_data.description: Lurking Raptors can't attack the enemy player or block.
card_data.name: Lurking Raptors

ej.notes: This is a build around grade. You'd want 5+ Rectifiers at which point this card becomes kinda busted. Attacking for 6 on turn 3 would be very powerful indeed.

card_data.description: Pay 3 to draw a Sigil of your choice from your deck. After the third use, sacrifice Waystone Gate. ; Entomb: If it's your turn, play an 8/8 Giant.
card_data.name: Waystone Gate

ej.notes: Very slow fixing, but with a big payoff. Can be activated multiple times in one turn with enough power though.

card_data.description: +2 Maximum Power.; Pay 2 and sacrifice Ancestral Oasis to Invoke {T}.
card_data.name: Ancestral Oasis

ej.notes: Relic based ramp in a deck where relic cost matters and/or you have a critcal mass of impactful 6+ drops to ramp into make this card more playable. Finding it late and being useless is mitigated by the ability to cantrip it for a total of 6 power in the late game.

card_data.description: Transform a unit or relic into an Elemental with Attack/ Health equal to its cost.
card_data.name: Formbend

ej.notes: There are some powerful relics in the format, but I'd rather run some actual attachment removal than this for the most part.

card_data.description: Play a relic weapon, a non-weapon relic, and a non-relic weapon from your void.
card_data.name: Unlock the Vault

ej.notes: In the right deck, this will be a Smuggler's Stash on steroids. In the wrong deck, it will be a 6 cost do-nothing stuck in your hand.

card_data.description: The cursed unit can't attack.
card_data.name: Timidity

ej.notes: Can help you not die, but often the unit still being able to block is still going to be pretty bad for you at some point.

card_data.description: Spellcraft 3: Play Reinforce.
card_data.name: Keeper's Shield

ej.notes: Killing an x/3 for 3 is fine. With extra power it can be a 6 cost mithrill mace basicaly with some 2 for 1 potential.

card_data.description: Draw a card of your choice from your deck.; You may exhaust a unit to play Linrei's Kiss for 2 less.
card_data.name: Linrei's Kiss

ej.notes: In a deck with a game-winning bomb card to fetch the value goes way up here, but at it's worst you're taking a turn off to get your best card/answer. Playable tutor effect but not terribly exciting, especially at slow speed.

card_data.description: +1/+1 for each of the wielder's battle skills.; Spellcraft 1: Play Fall Short.; Mastery 7: Invoke {J}.
card_data.name: Master's Blade

ej.notes: 2/2 weapon plus fall short for 4 power on average seems quite good to me. There are plenty of impactful vanilla units and since the fall short is on an already good weapon it mitigates the risk of running it with no good targets. The mastery 7 is not that hard to pull off either if you have this on an evasive unit and then it replaces itself.

card_data.description: Give yourself or a unit +Health equal to the highest Health unit in your void.; Decimate: Invoke {T}.
card_data.name: Earth Conjuring

ej.notes: Harder to cast and enable Refresh with potential upside

card_data.description: Stun two enemy units.; Decimate: Invoke {P}.
card_data.name: Water Conjuring

ej.notes: Harder to cast Flash Freeze with upside. Fast stun effects like this can be a real blowout in combat or can just help you win the game. Also, yay invoke when you already have enough power in play; but these types of effect usually just help you win the game when cast already.

card_data.description: Give a unit +Attack/- Health equal to the highest Attack among units in your void.; Decimate: Invoke {S}.
card_data.name: Pack Conjuring

ej.notes: Situational removal or combat trick that can replace itself when you don't care about losing a maximum power. SeemsGood.

card_data.description: Your units get +2 Attack this turn.; Decimate: Invoke {F}.
card_data.name: Fire Conjuring

ej.notes: Harder to cast rally with upside. Better in a go-wide style deck but the invoke makes it more generally playable. Only want 1 or 2 of these in pretty much any deck

card_data.description: Ready a unit. It gets +4/+4 and Endurance this turn.; Decimate: Invoke {J}.
card_data.name: Wind Conjuring

ej.notes: Cheaper, but harder to cast High Alert with upside. Would be easy A if this were more splashable.

card_data.description: Your single-faction units have Warcry.; Spellcraft 4: Play Obliterate.; Pay 5 and sacrifice two units to play a 7/7 Dragon with Flying and Overwhelm.
card_data.name: Shavka's Lute

ej.notes: This card does it all at. I'm the least excited about the static ability here, but there other two are extremely powerful. The ability to turn early game dorks into flying monstrosities is a crazy ability for 5 cost and with no restriction on the number of times you can use it.

card_data.description: When you play a single-faction unit, it gets +1 Attack.; Spellcraft 1: Play Warlock's Brew.; Pay 6 to give a single-faction unit +Attack equal to the highest Attack unit in your void.
card_data.name: Makkar's Quiver

ej.notes: This card does a lot of things, but none of them very well. If you have a good amount of quickdraw or unblockable units, the potential goes way up here, but otherwise I'm not very excited to play this card.

card_data.description: Your Exalted weapons get played on each of your single-faction units instead.; Spellcraft 3: Play Xulta Convoy.; Pay 4 to give one of your single-faction units +5/+5 this turn.
card_data.name: Kodosh's Armor

ej.notes: The spellcraft is already on-rate for the cost and gives you two reasonable targets for the static ability. It also has a power sink for later in the game that is on par with Rallying Banner.

card_data.description: Your single-faction units have Flying.; Spellcraft 3: Play Crystallize.; Pay 6 to draw a card for each of your single-faction units.
card_data.name: Linrei's Codex

ej.notes: If you're already heavily in Primal, this card is very much bomb-tier. Crystallize is always a beating in draft and if that doesn't do the trick you can use it to draw back into some gas. Does nothing without a board presence though.

card_data.description: Your single-faction units have Exalted.; Spellcraft 3: Play Bury the Past.; Pay 5 to draw a card. If it's a single-faction unit, play it.
card_data.name: Grodov's Burden

ej.notes: These abilities are all great in limited. The only reason I'm not going straight A here is the triple time influence.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, they stun a non-Stranger enemy unit.; When Linrei's Stranger attacks, play a 3/3 Dragon with Flying.
card_data.name: Linrei's Stranger

ej.notes: This seems pretty fantastic. If you can prioritize strangers, this guy gets even more busted. One attack with him and you're already feeling pretty great. The ability will help you get that attack or more in.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, they play a random Sigil from their deck.; When Grodov's Stranger attacks, shuffle a void of your choice into its owner's deck, then draw a card.
card_data.name: Grodov's Stranger

ej.notes: Overstatted 6 drop that does something nice when it (or another stranger) is summoned and also draws 2 when only it attacks? This card seems pretty busted. It's extra nice that the symmetrical effect isn't that scary.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, it deals 3 damage to a non-Stranger enemy.; When Shavka's Stranger attacks, you get +1 power this turn for each of your units.
card_data.name: Shavka's Stranger

ej.notes: Solid enough body with a relevant ETB ability. The power burst doesn't really seem meaningful though since it has to be the unit attacking and you likely already have 7+ power. This makes your late game fixing stranger draws a lot better at least, but also your opponent's which is pretty scary.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, they draw the top card of the other player's deck.; When Makkar's Stranger attacks, kill a non-Stranger enemy unit.
card_data.name: Makkar's Stranger

ej.notes: If you just play this guy and attack once and trade, you've already pulled off an easy 2 for 1. This gets a little scary for you though if it hangs out unable to attack for whatever reason and your opponent starts playing a bunch of strangers.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, the top unit or weapon of their deck gets +Attack/+Health equal to that Stranger's  Attack/ Health.; When Kodosh's Stranger attacks, double his  Attack/ Health.
card_data.name: Kodosh's Stranger

ej.notes: This can be a bomb, but needs other support cards to be good. It attacks the first time as a 4/4 so on curve on the play maybe it gets there, but there's too much room for this to just be a 2/2 for 3 while also randomly helping out your opponent when they play their inevitable strangers out. If your deck has a lot of tricks and strangers that can push this rating into bomb territory, but I'm still weary about the static ability doing more for my opponent.

card_data.description: Your curses can't be killed.; Eloz is invulnerable to damage while the enemy player and each of their units are cursed.
card_data.name: Eloz, Nightmare General

ej.notes: Difficult to cast and nearly impossible to activate invulnerabiliy makes this seem like a pretty bad draft card. There is not a lot of curse killing going on either; in the draft format it's more likely they will be silenced I feel like.

card_data.description: Sacrifice a unit to play two 1/1 Cultists.
card_data.name: Urgent Missive

ej.notes: Trading in your dieing unit for 2 1/1's is not very exciting, but will be a roleplayer in a sac deck. Still at least playable at its worst.

card_data.description: Flying; When Karvet deals damage, gain {F}{P}{S}.; At the end of each player's turn, Karvet deals 1 damage to them.
card_data.name: Karvet, Redeemed

ej.notes: Overstatted, evasive, very splashable 5 drop that randomly helps fix your influence while also reducing both players' life totals. Technically synergizes with Tainted Mark, but with this dragon in play you should already be winning that game.

card_data.description: Give one of your units Deadly. Then give a unit, weapon, or spell in your hand Deadly.
card_data.name: Touch of Battle

ej.notes: Interesting combat trick/buff with huge potential upside. Turns Ruinous Burst into a busted removal spell for example

card_data.description: Play a 1/1 Cultist.; You may swap a card from your hand with a 5-cost card in your Market.
card_data.name: Crack the Earth

ej.notes: Making a single 1/1 at fast speed is not very exciting at all, but the ability to grab a situationally powerful 5 drop in the later game makes this slightly more playable.

card_data.description: Pledge; When you sacrifice another unit, Sunset Enforcer gets +2/+2.
card_data.name: Sunset Enforcer

ej.notes: Understatted 6 drop, but pledging in opening hand is nice and will be able to crash in as a 7/7 in a deck with enough corrupted units or sac effects.

card_data.description: Endurance; Summon: Put an enemy unit into its owner's hand.; Corrupted 3
card_data.name: Corpsebloom

ej.notes: Expensive, but reasonably statted with a relevant summon effect. Also, endurance is nice on such a large unit. Rating is lower if the format turns out to be faster than I'm thinking currently.

card_data.description: Deal 7 damage to each unit and site.
card_data.name: Solar Blast

ej.notes: Too expensive and too influence heavy situational board wipe. I'd only play this if I'm trying to live the dream of giving this spell deadly + overwhelm.

card_data.description: Exalted on your turn.
card_data.name: Stonepowder Bomber

ej.notes: Decent statline and pretty good at attacking. Less good on defense since it won't pass on a weapon.

card_data.description: Your avatar can attack sites.; When your avatar attacks a unit, silence it.
card_data.name: Hammer of Glory

ej.notes: Powerful removal with recursion available in the format. Restrictive influence and the fact that it's initial attack power is 4 keeps it from being a bomb.

card_data.description: Depleted; Gain {T}, {J}, or {P}.
card_data.name: Token of Tradition

ej.notes: Depleted power but 3 colors of fixing makes these very desirable to help splash some busted cards, but you only want to play so much depleted power in any given deck.

card_data.description: Depleted; Gain {F}, {T}, or {J}.
card_data.name: Token of Creation

ej.notes: Depleted power but 3 colors of fixing makes these very desirable to help splash some busted cards, but you only want to play so much depleted power in any given deck.

card_data.description: Depleted; Gain {J}, {P}, or {S}.
card_data.name: Token of Purpose

ej.notes: Depleted power but 3 colors of fixing makes these very desirable to help splash some busted cards, but you only want to play so much depleted power in any given deck.

card_data.description: Depleted; Gain {F}, {T}, or {S}.
card_data.name: Token of Destruction

ej.notes: Depleted power but 3 colors of fixing makes these very desirable to help splash some busted cards, but you only want to play so much depleted power in any given deck.

card_data.description: Depleted; Gain {F}, {P}, or {S}.
card_data.name: Token of Menace

ej.notes: Depleted power but 3 colors of fixing makes these very desirable to help splash some busted cards, but you only want to play so much depleted power in any given deck.

card_data.description: - Put an enemy unit into its owner's hand, then increase its cost by the highest cost among your relics, or; - Give one of your units +2 Health and Killer, or; - Silence the enemy void. Draw a card.
card_data.name: Display of Tradition

ej.notes: Restrictive influence. The most exciting mode on average seems to be the killer plus health buff, but the other modes can be situationally good as well. Silencing a void in response to void recursion can be a real thing, but will be hard to convince me to hold up the power for this ability until the right time. The cost increase can be real removal with a high-enough cost relic in play as well.

card_data.description: - Draw two random sigils from your deck, or; - Silence each attacking enemy unit. They get -2 Attack this turn, or; - Give one of your units +2 Attack. Gain 2 Armor.
card_data.name: Display of Creation

ej.notes: Restrictive influence. Only really exciting mode is the super fog second mode that silences and Flash Grenades attacking enemy units.

card_data.description: - Deal 3 damage to an enemy unit and you gain 3 Health, or; - Sacrifice a unit to get +6 power this turn, or; - Play three 1/1 Cultists exhausted.
card_data.name: Display of Destruction

ej.notes: Restrictive influence. All 3 modes seem situationally great. The second 2 modes are particularly strong in the sacrifice synergy deck which is what these colors are generally trying to do already and the other mode is relatively strong situational removal.

card_data.description: - Give one of your units +1/+1 and Exalted, or; - Deal 7 damage to an enemy unit played this turn, or; - Steal an enemy relic with cost 3 or less.
card_data.name: Display of Purpose

ej.notes: Restrictive influence. All 3 modes seem situationally great. Not too unreasonable to hold up 3 power for the opponent's potential bomby unit to kill and if you decide the threat is not there can just premptively utilize the exalted buff mode.

card_data.description: - Deal 1 damage to each enemy, or; - Kill an enemy relic and give relics in the enemy void Voidbound, or; - Sacrifice a unit to draw two of the top four cards of your deck. Bottom the rest.
card_data.name: Display of Menace

ej.notes: Restrictive influence. All 3 modes are situationally good, but moreso than the Display of Destruction. No real synergy with what Menace colors are generally trying to do as far as I can tell.

card_data.description: Summon: Gain an influence of your choice.; Corrupted 1
card_data.name: Unfamiliar Interloper

ej.notes: Playable color fixer in an extra-greedy multifaction deck and has some slight upside potential in a sac synergy or stranger syngergy deck. Understatted body means I'd rather have basically any color-fixing 2/2 stranger instead of this.

card_data.description: Endurance; Your units with two or more battle skills have +1 Attack.
card_data.name: Reborn Master

ej.notes: Another Bold Adventurer with upside. Influence lowers the rating a bit, but brought back up to B- with a battle skill and Unseen synergy.

card_data.description: Deal 1 damage to each unit.; Lifesteal while the enemy player has ten or more cards in their void, and Deadly while they have twenty or more.
card_data.name: Essence Feast

ej.notes: In some kind of serious mill deck this can be a full board wipe I guess? Without this magical Christmas land scenario, if you're not playing any x/1's maybe you can kill some of the opponent's? Not fast and also deals the damage to your units.

card_data.description: Deal 2 damage.; Your Dragons go Berserk.
card_data.name: Provoke the Dragons

ej.notes: Deal 2 damage at a reasonable rate with upside. Slow speed brings it down slightly. Goes up with more dragon synergy and any spell damage.

card_data.description: Pledge; Lifesteal and Unblockable while the enemy player has ten or more cards in their void.
card_data.name: Spore-Spitter

ej.notes: In a mill deck this is a real win-con. Without reliably getting the mill threshold though it's just an overcosted vanilla 4/4.

card_data.description: Flying, Killer; Pay 7 to deal 1 damage to the enemy player for each card in their hand.
card_data.name: Brutal Frostlord

ej.notes: Solid evasive body with the potential for a 2 for 1. Activated ability can also help close out the game. Very close to bomb-tier for me.

card_data.description: Deal 3 damage.
card_data.name: Sear

ej.notes: Cheap, fast, splashable removal that can go face. Kreygasm

card_data.description: Once per turn, you may pay 2 to give one of your units Exalted, then sacrifice it.
card_data.name: Flamebathe Reformation

ej.notes: There's certainly some decks in the format that will actually want to play this card but it's too situational to be great. Trading in a humbug and giving a real unit flying is a scenario I can see being useful in a more average deck though.

card_data.description: Stun each enemy unit with Flying.; You may exhaust a unit to play Resounding Shockwave for 2 less.
card_data.name: Resounding Shockwave

ej.notes: Situational card. Not big on slow stun effects in general, but against the right opponent this will be a cheap mass board stun.

card_data.description: When a unit goes to the enemy void, Darkmask Stalker gets its battle skills.; Mastery 12: The enemy player discards the top twelve cards of their deck.
card_data.name: Darkmask Stalker

ej.notes: Solid body with massive upside. Doesn't care if the cards were milled, discarded, trade in combat, or are killed, as long as they go to the enemy void.

card_data.description: Deadly, Unblockable; Mastery 5: Draw one of the top five cards of the enemy player's deck. They discard the rest.
card_data.name: Felrauk's Infiltrator

ej.notes: Slow win-con and slowly can replace itself. Good on both offense and defense and plays well with weapons and void recursion. Seems pretty good all around despite the unexciting baseline stats.

card_data.description: Kill an attacking enemy unit with Flying.
card_data.name: Ensnare

ej.notes: Flier removal was good in the last format and seems even better now with further emphasis on flier strategies. Holding up power for a 1-cost spell is an easy ask.

card_data.description: Your units with Flying have +1/+1.; Ultimate: Pay 6 to draw a unit with Flying of your choice from your deck.
card_data.name: Majestic Skies

ej.notes: Buffing fliers across your board and a late game tutor for your best flier. Majestic indeed.

card_data.description: Your Dragons cost 1 less.; Your spells deal +1 damage while you have a Dragon.
card_data.name: Spellbound Vestige

ej.notes: This is just condition after condition. Only ramps dragons and you only get the spell damage with a dragon in play means I am just not excited to play this card really in the vast majority of draft decks.

card_data.description: Pledge; +3/+3 while the enemy player has ten or more cards in their void.
card_data.name: Overlook Spotter

ej.notes: Durdley 2 drop with a mill threshold pay off. Pledge is always nice and brings it up to a C.

card_data.description: Give two of your units +1/+4 and Flying this turn.
card_data.name: Divebomb

ej.notes: Can help you alpha strike or be used to 2 for 1 potentially as a combat trick. Holding up 4 power is a big ask though.

card_data.description: Kill each unit with fewer than two battle skills.
card_data.name: Unseen Execution

ej.notes: This card gets a very high build-around rating from me. It can basically be a one-sided board wipe in a battle skill synergy deck. You'd only really prioritize this though after that deck is already coming together well.

card_data.description: The enemy player sacrifices an uncursed unit of their choice, then discards cards from the top of their deck equal to its  Attack.
card_data.name: Succumb

ej.notes: Kills something, but gives too much agency to the opponent to actually be good. Also too expensive for the effect.

card_data.description: Deal 1 damage to two enemies.
card_data.name: Ruinous Burst

ej.notes: Fast/flexible but not that powerful. Rating goes way up with spell damage enablers or touch of battle.

card_data.description: Kill an enemy unit with cost 3 or less. Then steal it and put it into your void.
card_data.name: Defile

ej.notes: Reasonable removal and splashable. Real upside when you or your opponent are running void recursion.

card_data.description: Draw a relic or power card from the top five cards of your deck. Put the rest on the bottom.
card_data.name: Calibrate

ej.notes: Bad seek power with some potential upside with enough relics in your deck.

card_data.description: Draw a unit from your void. It gets +2/+2.
card_data.name: Triumphant Return

ej.notes: Expensive dark return with a real stat buff. Sign me up. Like most effects like this, there's a real limit to how many you want in your deck though.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, they gain 1 Health and 1 Armor.; Pay 4 and exhaust Strange Duelist to silence a non-Stranger unit.
card_data.name: Strange Duelist

ej.notes: Bazaar Trickster always seemed to overperform and I think this guy will too. The symmetrical effect is not a spooky one either.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, they replenish one power.; Pay 4 and exhaust Strange Sorcerer to draw a card for each of your units with Flying.
card_data.name: Strange Sorcerer

ej.notes: Another relatively harmless symmetrical effect, but a huge card advantage engine in a fliers deck. Build around B+.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, they play a -1/-1 curse on a non-Stranger enemy unit.; Pay 2 and exhaust Strange Ally to give one of your units a random battle skill.
card_data.name: Strange Ally

ej.notes: If you can be very stranger heavy, this goes up quite a bit. The activated ability goes great in the J/S unseen deck as well. Without some of the build arounds though this will just be an understatted unit that dies to almost all the removal in the format.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, they draw a relic from the top six cards of their deck and bottom the rest.; Pay 3 and exhaust Strange Rider. He gets +Attack/+Health for your highest cost relic.
card_data.name: Strange Rider

ej.notes: There are enough people running relics and relic weapons in the format that the symmetrical effect here has some potential to hurt you as much as help you. In the right deck it should be able to come out and replace itself at least though and given enough time can become too large for your opponent to deal with.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, each unit in their void gets +1/+1.; Pay 9 and exhaust Strange Navigator to draw five units from your void.
card_data.name: Strange Navigator

ej.notes: This is another stranger with a powerful late-game effect. Getting to 9 is a tough ask, but the card advantage potential there is massive. The symmetrical effect will likely influence your deck construction so you can probably capitalize on it more than your opponent.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, their enemy discards the top four cards of their deck.; Pay 7 and exhaust Strange Broker to play Permafrost on a non-Stranger unit.
card_data.name: Strange Broker

ej.notes: Repeatable 7-cost permafrosts is a very enticing ability. If you are also in some kind of mill deck, the symmetrical ability can also do some work. Jedi's opponents will always incidentally mill his best cards though.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, their units get +1 Attack this turn.; Pay 2, exhaust Strange Burglar, and sacrifice another unit to draw three cards and take 3 damage.
card_data.name: Strange Burglar

ej.notes: This has the potential to help your opponent as much as you with the symmetrical effect, but in a sac deck the card advantage will be very real.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, units and weapons in their hand get +1/+1.; Pay 4 and exhaust Strange Gladiator to kill an enemy relic.
card_data.name: Strange Gladiator

ej.notes: Solid stats and a very relevant activated ability make this card very solid. The symmetrical ability has a chance to help your opponent out too much to be rated higher for me, but I think I'd usually take the risk to play this card.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, they draw a weapon from their void.; Pay 8 and exhaust Strange Blacksmith to deal 3 damage to an enemy and you gain 3 Armor.
card_data.name: Strange Blacksmith

ej.notes: This stranger has a lot more one-sided potential than most of the others in the format. Chances that you can capitalize on the weapon ability better than your opponent are significant and the 8 cost activated ability is repeatable removal on a stick. Seems pretty great, but can't just win you the game so I feel like I can't give it a straight up A.

card_data.description: When a player plays a Stranger, it goes Berserk.; Pay 3 and exhaust Strange Tracker to draw a Dragon of your choice from your deck that you haven't played this game.
card_data.name: Strange Tracker

ej.notes: Strangers going berserk is not really something I care much about on either side of the board, but tutoring out a dragon every turn this is out for 3 power is very exciting to me.

card_data.description: Summon: Give a unit Quickdraw.; Corrupted 1
card_data.name: Entranced Cultist

ej.notes: Giving a unit quickdraw at slow speed is just not that exciting. Goes up a bit with sac synergies though but not quite in the build-around category.

card_data.description: Choose a unit in the enemy player's hand to steal and play. It gets Charge. Sacrifice it at the end of the turn.; You may exhaust a unit to play Dark Betrayal for 2 less.
card_data.name: Dark Betrayal

ej.notes: Playing this on or near curve can be pretty great, but can also completely whiff. Situationally good but not necessarily up to you.

card_data.description: Play a 4/2 Dragon with Flying and Charge.; You may exhaust a unit to play Thunder of Wings for 2 less.
card_data.name: Thunder of Wings

ej.notes: Mostly expect this to be played for 3 cost and get in for 4 damage at least once.

card_data.description: Draw each spell and Dragon with cost 5 or more from the top ten cards of your deck. Put the rest on the bottom.
card_data.name: Volatility

ej.notes: This card has some constructed playability, but I'm really not looking to play this in any draft deck. You only want so many spells and dragons that cost 5 or more in any given deck making building around this a huge liability most of the time and when there are only a few hits available the chances that it whiffs completely are too high. No thanks.

card_data.description: Endurance; Summon: Ready your units. The enemy player can't play spells until your next turn.; Corrupted 2
card_data.name: Camoni, Dusk Rider

ej.notes: Solid body, but the summon will only be relevant occasionally in draft. I'd play this just for the big Endurance unit though and it will occasionally generate some additional value when your units have exhaust abilities or you just get in a big swing and can play this after the fact to have a surprise defensive line. Breaks the occasional permafrost as well.

card_data.description: Summon: +1 Attack for each of your units.
card_data.name: Assault Shield

ej.notes: Too situational to be good

card_data.description: At the start of your turn, sacrifice a unit, then you gain 3 Health and get +3 power this turn.
card_data.name: Awakened Gorger

ej.notes: No flying when the picture has wings makes me a sad panda. Overstatted non-evasive unit that can be a real threat in a deck built with plenty of sac fodder in mind.

card_data.description: Overwhelm; The first relic ability you Spellcraft or activate each turn costs 3 less.
card_data.name: Shardbinder

ej.notes: Pyre Adept with upside

card_data.description: Flying; Invulnerable to damage on your turn.; Ultimate: Pay 4 to draw a relic from your void.
card_data.name: Inner-Peace Ascendant

ej.notes: Not terrible stats on a flyer, but invulnerability on your turn on 1 attack unit will only be really relevant when attacking into opposing x/1 fliers or with combat tricks or weapons in your deck. Ultimate not too expensive and can bring back a relic weapon so can be relevant without too much set up.

card_data.description: Deal 2 damage to the enemy player. You gain an Aegis.; You may swap a card from your hand with a 4-cost card in your Market.
card_data.name: Transpose

ej.notes: There's not enough face aegis in the format for me to actively want to run this card. If your deck has a critcal mass of powerful relics you want to protect as well as some situational four drops I suppose you run this?

card_data.description: Give a unit Flying.; You may swap a card from your hand with a 3-cost card in your Market.
card_data.name: Fearless Crescendo

ej.notes: Giving a large unit flying has always been a good way to gain advantage in draft formats and this card also lets you swap out something like a power card or 2 drop you decide is no longer needed for a situational 3-cost card from your market.

card_data.description: Lifesteal; +Health equal to the highest cost among your relics.
card_data.name: Rageheart Paladin

ej.notes: With an expensive relic out, this guy will really help grind the ground to a halt, but otherwise it is just not great.

card_data.description: Aegis, Charge, Endurance; Summon: Enemy units are Reckless and can't fly until your next turn.; Corrupted 2
card_data.name: Albon, Fallen

ej.notes: Situationally hoses a flier deck if you have some solid units on the ground. Weak stats and difficult influence makes this Albon truly fallen though for me.

card_data.description: +1 Maximum Power.; When you play a relic weapon, it gets +1 Attack.
card_data.name: Pillar of Progress

ej.notes: A ramping relic with upside. Ramp that's hard to interact with is usually pretty playable and definitely gets better when you can also utilize the weapon buff. Can also help a relic matters deck.

card_data.description: +Attack/+Health equal to the highest cost among your relics.
card_data.name: Monument Curator

ej.notes: Situationally good body. Reasonable with any relic at all in play and has potential to be large. Fluctuating stats and weakness to silence brings it down for me.

card_data.description: The cursed player can't play more than one spell each turn.; When they draw a card, you gain 1 Health.
card_data.name: Arcane Restraint

ej.notes: There's not any real lifeforce synergies in the format to make this actually playable. Only hoses spells and many can be done on your turn anyway. Pass.

card_data.description: +Attack equal to your Maximum Power.; When Yojimba hits the enemy player, draw two cards.; When the enemy player plays a unit, they silence Yojimba.
card_data.name: Yojimba, Ghostblade

ej.notes: Why???

card_data.description: Deal 6 damage to an attacking enemy.
card_data.name: Biting Winds

ej.notes: Reasonable removal and splashable.

card_data.description: Flying; Summon: +Attack equal to the highest Attack unit in your void.
card_data.name: Skeletal Dragon

ej.notes: On average a Skysnapper Drake with just a bit of set up, but hey at least it's not reckless?

card_data.description: Aegis; When you play another Unseen, it gets a random battle skill.
card_data.name: Outcast Elite

ej.notes: Aegis means it's going to wear weapons very well, but basline is not great. Can high roll some really good skills, but need a ton of Unseen and luck to be on your side.

card_data.description: Pledge; When you attack with one or more units with Flying, play a 2/3 Wolf.
card_data.name: Uelo, Sky Tactician

ej.notes: This is one of those Pledge units you'll always risk a sketchy opener by not actually pledging. It is already a great unit on it's own, but the triggered ability here is nuts. Lets you really gum up the board so your fliers deck can just keep swinging in the air.

card_data.description: Pay 4 to give one of your units with Flying +1/+1.
card_data.name: Sky Worshipper

ej.notes: 1 drop with big booty can block a lot over many turns. Ability is not prohibitively expensive and boosts attack and health on any flyer when you need it or have spare power.

card_data.description: Flying; Spells and weapons cost 1 more.; Mastery 2: Play all power cards from your hand.
card_data.name: Alluring Qirin

ej.notes: The weird mastery brings this one up from a D for me. If you actually get to play this on turn 1, there's a chance it will be good for you in that game, letting you spam all your power out a bit ahead of schedule. Mostly it will be a 1/1 flier that will randomly hose opponent markets.

card_data.description: When the cursed player plays a spell or attachment, they deal 1 damage to themselves.
card_data.name: Static Discharge

ej.notes: Hard to interact with, but gives opponent agency as to when/if it does anything. Goes up a bit with curse/relic synergies, but basically a do-nothing 3 cost relic at its worst.

card_data.description: When one or more Strangers attack, their owner plays a 1/1 Cultist.
card_data.name: Fanatical Stranger

ej.notes: Understatted, but brings a 1/1 friend with one attack. Very unexciting and doesn't get better when multiple strangers are attacking, but can help generate some fodder in a sac synergy deck.

card_data.description: Draw a weapon from your void. It and each weapon in your deck get +1 Attack.
card_data.name: Soldrain Smithing

ej.notes: Weapon recursion with upside.

card_data.description: Flying; Mastery 3: Increase the damage of a spell in your hand by 3.; Mastery 12: Create and draw three copies of a spell in your hand.
card_data.name: Acedonis, Untainted

ej.notes: Evasive unit with good stats and not too hard to splash in any deck that's in either fire or primal. The mastery effects on this have the opportunity to be completely busted, but will not just work 100% of the time so not quite bomb-tier.

card_data.description: When you play a curse and a relic in the same turn, play Dying Sun Tapestry from your hand for free.; At the end of your turn, give one of your exhausted units +1/+1 and Overwhelm.
card_data.name: Dying Sun Tapestry

ej.notes: A bit expensive for what it does (when are you ever going to play this for free?), but in a deck with relic cost matters synergies this can be a real card for sure.

card_data.description: Draw a card from your void.; It gets Voidbound.
card_data.name: Turn Back Time

ej.notes: Recur any card from your void in time. Anything from threats to answers to value generation depending on the situation. Won't want more than 1 or 2 in any given deck, but that first one has a pretty high value IMO.

card_data.description: When one or more units hit the cursed player, draw a card.
card_data.name: Tainted Mark

ej.notes: In the grindiest of decks this will be real card advantage, but it's just too expensive and too slow in the majority of decks to be good. Goes up a bit with relic synergies and lots of evasion, but baseline is pretty bad.

card_data.description: Play two 1/1 Humbugs with Flying.
card_data.name: Humbug Nest

ej.notes: 2 1/1 fliers as a combat trick? Reasonably costed as well. SeemsGood

card_data.description: Flying; Mastery 2: Create and draw an Eternity Core.
card_data.name: Platinum Qirin

ej.notes: Expensive cloudsnake hatchling with upside?

card_data.description: Charge; Once per turn, you may pay 4 to give Shield of the Line +Attack/+Health equal to the highest Health among units in your void this turn.
card_data.name: Shield of the Line

ej.notes: Too situational to be great all the time, but with a little set up can be a strong unit later in the game. Doesn't keep its buffs, sadly. For the most part, I'd rather play Gravewatch Ancestor.

card_data.description: Create and draw a Power Burst, a 0/1 Totemite, a Treasure Trove, and an 8/8 Giant.
card_data.name: Victor's Feast

ej.notes: I guess this goes up when you care about how many cards you draw in a turn? Seems too durdley with the real pay-off coming very late game unless you're a real ramp deck (generates an 8/8 vanilla unit for 8)

card_data.description: Draw cards equal to the highest cost among your relics.
card_data.name: Abyssal Scrying

ej.notes: You're not even going to be all that happy drawing 3 cards off of this when your opponent plays Distillation and does it for 4. If you're running a couple of impactful relics with 4 or more cost I guess I'd consider playing this card?

card_data.description: Pledge; When you play a relic, draw a card.; Mastery 10: Create and draw three random relics.
card_data.name: Wren, Traditionalist

ej.notes: Unless you're in a relic synergy deck, this is just a hard to cast 5/5 with pledge. If you can capitalize on the card draw, it seems pretty great.

card_data.description: Switchblade Deadeye has +2/+2 while she has a battle skill.
card_data.name: Switchblade Deadeye

ej.notes: 2/1 for 2 with questionable upside. Not too hard to pull off, but you'd be more excited to grant battle skills to a unit that's already more impressive or evasive in some way.

card_data.description: When you sacrifice a unit, the cursed player sacrifices a unit.
card_data.name: Induce Madness

ej.notes: This is a powerful effect for a build-around deck. There's so many ways to enable this in the format I think it can definitely do some work in the right deck.

card_data.description: Deal 3 damage.; If the enemy player has ten or more cards in their void, draw three cards. If they have twenty or more, play three 6/4 Dragons with Flying and Overwhelm.
card_data.name: Savage Incursion

ej.notes: If you're already a mill deck of some sort, I'd play this card. Otherwise, it's a hard pass.

card_data.description: You may sacrifice Nesting Raven to play a 1/1 Raven with Flying.
card_data.name: Nesting Raven

ej.notes: Gums up the ground if you want it to or a Humbug when you want it to be. Free sacrifice, but not in the colors that really care about that. Doesn't transform or fly initially, so putting a weapon on it while a 0/4 doesn't carry over to the 1/1 flier sadly. Solid 1 drop in primal though.

card_data.description: Exalted; Mastery 5: Play a 3/4 relic weapon.
card_data.name: Mithril Paladin

ej.notes: Expensive and unimpressive body but the upside is real. Blocks decently well and after 2 hits without dieing you get a real removal spell for free. Decently sized exalted weapon when it dies. Value goes way up in a deck with some good combat tricks like Finest Hour or Wind Conjuring.

card_data.description: Exalted; Mastery 2: Promising Pupil gets a random battle skill.
card_data.name: Promising Pupil

ej.notes: Gets better with buffs, but at worst is an overcosted Crownwatch Longsword that gains you a bit of life.

card_data.description: Play a 1-cost unit, a 2-cost unit, and a 3-cost unit from your void. They get +1/+1 and Overwhelm.
card_data.name: Eremot's Machinations

ej.notes: With a little set up this card can really swing a game. The floor is unfortunately low however so I feel like I can't put it quite in the A category.

card_data.description: Quickdraw, Pledge; When the wielder hits the enemy player, they lose their remaining power and you get that much power this turn.; Spellcraft 3: Play Holdup.
card_data.name: Unseen Longbow

ej.notes: Top-heavy quickdraw weapon that can sometimes snipe two cards from the opponent's hand is something I'm very interested in playing.

card_data.description: Lifesteal; Deal 1 damage to an enemy. If it dies this turn, it gets Voidbound.; You may swap a card from your hand with a 1-cost card in your Market.
card_data.name: Condemn

ej.notes: Dealing 1 damage at fast speed means this is just barely playable, but with the tacked on ability of swapping a dead card for a semi-useful one brings it up slightly from unplayable. Only grabbing 1 cost from the market is not very exciting either.

card_data.description: Ultimate: Pay 6 to give Gravewatch Ancestor +Attack/+Health equal to the highest Health among units in your void.
card_data.name: Gravewatch Ancestor

ej.notes: This set's version of Spiketail Qirin?

card_data.description: Your units have +2 Attack, Charge, and Lifesteal if you have sacrificed a unit this turn.
card_data.name: Shrine to Karvet

ej.notes: This is a build around card that can help you quickly close out a game with some sac synergies in your deck.

card_data.description: Once per turn, you may pay 3 to give one of your units +2/+2 and Endurance this turn.; Spellcraft 1: Play Endure.
card_data.name: Siege Provisions

ej.notes: Seems like the definition of medium. Might let you get in to the red zone sometimes when you otherwise can't and has some relic synergy, but these types of cards have always underperformed for me.

card_data.description: Deal 2 damage to a unit.; You may swap a card from your hand with a 2-cost card in your Market.
card_data.name: Blazing Salvo

ej.notes: Char with real upside. Surely you'll have something extra for 2 power by the end of your draft to jam into the market.

card_data.description: The wielder is invulnerable to damage on your turn.; Your units that share a type with the wielder cost 1 less.
card_data.name: Hammer of Unity

ej.notes: This card has some potential to be good, but the buff being only 2 means it is still very situationally dependent on whether it is good or not. If you can give this weapon deadly or slap it on a deadly unit, I'd be a lot more excited about playing this card.

card_data.description: Flying, Aegis; When Darktalon Wyvarch hits the enemy player, they discard cards from their deck until they discard a unit.
card_data.name: Darktalon Wyvarch

ej.notes: If you can slap a quickdraw weapon or boost it's attack and health in some way, this dragon can close out a game pretty quickly or will eat 2 of your opponent's removal spells. If you don't have a way to help continue it's ability to punch through, it will just end up being a harder to cast Brood of Eremot. Guaranteeing milling of a unit on each attack is a pretty powerful line of text.

card_data.description: Entomb: If it's your turn, draw seven cards and reduce their costs by 1. At the end of your turn, discard your hand.
card_data.name: Shavka's Embrace

ej.notes: Far too expenive to play in the vast majority of draft games with an entomb effect that doesn't excite me. Pass.

card_data.description: Warcry; Mastery 6: Put an 8/8 Sword of the Sky King into your deck.
card_data.name: Sky King Storyteller

ej.notes: Baseline is pretty bad here, but in a deck with oni buffs, combat tricks, and ability to fetch a weapon can be good.

card_data.description: The enemy player chooses two of their units to save, then sacrifices the rest.
card_data.name: Premature Burial

ej.notes: Although your opponent gets to keep their two best units, this card can be a real beating. Floor is pretty low.

card_data.description: Double Damage; Summon: Play a -1 Attack curse on each enemy unit with Flying.; Corrupted 3
card_data.name: Willbreaker

ej.notes: Situationally good card. Goes way up with weapons and combat tricks, and when playing an opponent who is swarming the board with fliers. Worst case it's just a 2/1 for 2 which is not great.

card_data.description: Pledge; When you sacrifice another unit, draw a card.; Mastery 10: Play Possessed by Horrors on the enemy player.
card_data.name: Dova, the Fearmonger

ej.notes: Unless you're in a sac synergy deck, this is just a hard to cast 5/5 with pledge. If you're in the sac deck, its ability seems pretty great.

card_data.description: Silence a unit with cost 3 or less and each copy in its owner's hand, deck, and void.
card_data.name: Deafening Word

ej.notes: Situational silence effect, but is playable since it is fast and only one cost and can hit multiple copies if you use it on a common like rectifier for example. Still, I'm not very excited for even the first copy of this in my deck.

card_data.description: When you play a relic weapon, play a +1 Attack weapon with Overwhelm on Kazuo.; Ultimate: Pay 4 to Invoke {F}.
card_data.name: Kazuo, Melee Virtuoso

ej.notes: Reasonable 1-drop with a very nice late game ability tacked on. Playing relic weapons helps Kazuo scale up for combat as you curve out.

card_data.description: Give one of your Flying units Deadly and Killer.
card_data.name: Precision Plunge

ej.notes: Turns any flier into an omnivorous vorlunk that can kill anything. Situtional removal that will usually 2 for 1 yourself.

card_data.description: When one or more Strangers attack, their owner's spells deal +1 damage until their next turn.
card_data.name: Spellstorm Stranger

ej.notes: Durdley 3 drop with a very situational and effect that sadly doens't stack with multiple strangers attacking.

card_data.description: When one or more Strangers attack, their owner creates and draws a Treasure Trove.
card_data.name: Covetous Stranger

ej.notes: Weak statted 2 drop that can replace itself relatively easily. Can generate real card advantage, but still basically dies upon attack.

card_data.description: When one or more Strangers attack, reduce the cost of the top card of their owner's deck by 2.
card_data.name: Magnificent Stranger

ej.notes: Bold adventurer with upside

card_data.description: When one or more Strangers attack, the top unit of their owner's deck gets a random battle skill.
card_data.name: Steely Stranger

ej.notes: Unimpressive body with a symmetrical and very random effect. Can only get one buff per turn at best (without some extra killer attacks going on) and it's a dice roll whether it will even matter.

card_data.description: Summon: Play a +1 Attack weapon with Overwhelm on one of your other units.; Corrupted 2
card_data.name: Markmaker

ej.notes: Decent baseline stats, oni synergy, weapon synergy, cheap corrupted activation. Solid all around

card_data.description: Pay 2 and exhaust Agent of Purpose to kill a cursed enemy unit and give Agent of Purpose its battle skills.
card_data.name: Agent of Purpose

ej.notes: Kind of a weird Icebreaker, but with real stats. Definitely has some real upside if you can give it some evasion via it's ability, but requires some set up to pull off between having curses (the right color combination for this at least) and the units you are cursing to have relevant battle skills.

card_data.description: Draw three cards.; You may exhaust a unit to play Nahid's Distillation for 2 less.
card_data.name: Nahid's Distillation

ej.notes: Drawing cards! My favorite! Easy to enable the cost reduction, which will sometimes be "free" and sometimes result in taking a bit of damage. Either way very much worth the price.

card_data.description: Pay 3 to deal 1 damage to an enemy. After the third use, sacrifice Bottled Storm. ; Entomb: If it's your turn, draw three cards.
card_data.name: Bottled Storm

ej.notes: Very slow way to draw 3 and maybe kill something. Goes up a bit with relic synergies, but doesn't care about spell damage buffs.

card_data.description: Summon: You may silence another unit.; Corrupted 2
card_data.name: Rectifier

ej.notes: Silence on a recurrable stick. Generates value when played and depending on the board state many opponents won't want to trade with this little guy in combat either. Cheap corrupted activation, but with a very fast clock.

card_data.description: Summon: Draw a weapon of your choice from your deck.; Corrupted 6
card_data.name: Bladecrafter

ej.notes: Tutors a weapon (up to sword of the sky king lul) and leaves behind a small body. Corrupted activation prohibitively expensive to expect to be able to hit it.

card_data.description: Warcry, Pledge; Summon: You gain 3 Armor and your avatar can attack an additional time this turn.; Corrupted 6
card_data.name: Jadehorn

ej.notes: Solid body with a relevant summon, battle skill, and pledge. With a little setup the summon can actually be pretty powerful. Double justice in the influence cost brings this one down a notch.

card_data.description: Lifesteal; Bloodwolf can't block.; Summon: You may swap another unit's Attack and Health.; Corrupted 2
card_data.name: Bloodwolf

ej.notes: Solid unit that can kill annoying corrupted units or make a 1/5 pingable, but the fact that it's hard to cast on curve (and you probably won't capitalize off of its summon then anyway) and then later in the game when you want to play it, it can't even block brings me way down on this guy.

card_data.description: Fate: Dancing Flame gets Charge, +2/+2, or its cost reduced by 2.
card_data.name: Dancing Flame

ej.notes: Decent body with upside, but the fact that the boost is random brings it down just a bit. At least all 3 options are reasonable.

card_data.description: Summon: Feartracker deals 3 damage to the enemy player and you gain 3 Health.; Corrupted 4
card_data.name: Feartracker

ej.notes: Solid body with relevant amount of life swing on summon. Chance to drain again with the Corrupted shade with a few turns to decide to activate it since it has a decent amount of health.

card_data.description: Summon: Deal 5 damage to two enemies.; Corrupted 5
card_data.name: Hammerhand

ej.notes: Great abilities on a medium body. The initial cost and influence on this one brings it way, way down for me.

card_data.description: Flying; Summon: Play Electropy on an enemy unit.; Corrupted 6
card_data.name: Plagued Gryffyn

ej.notes: Restrictive influence, but basically a wall in the air that can help you kill the opponent without even needing to attack. Corrupted means another chance to play an electropy and enough time to conceivably do so before withering away.

card_data.description: When you draw your second card in a turn, you get +2 power this turn.; Pay 4 to give one of your other units +4 Attack and Overwhelm this turn.
card_data.name: Tota Pioneer

ej.notes: This little guys does a lot. Power burst is nice and can really help you multi-spell over multiple turns. Troves are free with this guy. The activated ability will help your early game dorks actually power through some damage each turn while trading in combat.

card_data.description: Pledge; Spellcraft 2: Play Inspire.
card_data.name: Enchanted Platemail

ej.notes: Expensive removal for its stats, but ability to pledge in opener brings it up a bit.

card_data.description: Give a unit +1/+1 this turn.
card_data.name: Rage

ej.notes: Colorless combat trick, but only buffs +1/+1. Very unexciting.

card_data.description: Reckless; Summon: If you have a unit with Flying, Invoke {P}.; Corrupted 3
card_data.name: Highsky Lookout

ej.notes: This card can actually be good in the right deck (with fliers and ways to give this card flying), but takes too much set up for me to get really excited about this. In a perfect worl, you get two invokes off of this guy which is a real potential upside, but the reckless means it won't just be good in any deck.

card_data.description: Mastery 4: Your units with Flying get Killer.
card_data.name: Runemarker

ej.notes: Medium body with upside with a lot of set up.

card_data.description: Ambush; Summon: Play a random non-power card with cost 2 or less from your deck.; Corrupted 6
card_data.name: Gentle Grazer

ej.notes: Unless you're very much base time and have some impactful/reason to care about cards in your draft deck with cost 2 or less, this card will not be great.

card_data.description: Draw a Fire Sigil, Time Sigil, or Shadow Sigil from your deck.; Decimate: If you have {F}{F}{T}{T}{S}{S}, Invoke {F}{T}{S}.
card_data.name: Destruction Chant

ej.notes: These chants are all just bad seek powers unless you're actually in all 3 of it's colors. In that case, it's a seek power that you can use for a powerful replacement card later on in the game which is pretty fantastic.

card_data.description: Draw a Fire Sigil, Primal Sigil, or Shadow Sigil from your deck.; Decimate: If you have {F}{F}{P}{P}{S}{S}, Invoke {F}{P}{S}.
card_data.name: Menace Chant

ej.notes: These chants are all just bad seek powers unless you're actually in all 3 of it's colors. In that case, it's a seek power that you can use for a powerful replacement card later on in the game which is pretty fantastic.

card_data.description: Draw a Time Sigil, Justice Sigil, or Primal Sigil from your deck.; Decimate: If you have {T}{T}{J}{J}{P}{P}, Invoke {T}{J}{P}.
card_data.name: Tradition Chant

ej.notes: These chants are all just bad seek powers unless you're actually in all 3 of it's colors. In that case, it's a seek power that you can use for a powerful replacement card later on in the game which is pretty fantastic.

card_data.description: Draw a Justice Sigil, Primal Sigil, or Shadow Sigil from your deck.; Decimate: If you have {J}{J}{P}{P}{S}{S}, Invoke {J}{P}{S}.
card_data.name: Purpose Chant

ej.notes: These chants are all just bad seek powers unless you're actually in all 3 of it's colors. In that case, it's a seek power that you can use for a powerful replacement card later on in the game which is pretty fantastic.

card_data.description: Draw a Fire Sigil, Time Sigil, or Justice Sigil from your deck.; Decimate: If you have {F}{F}{T}{T}{J}{J}, Invoke {F}{T}{J}.
card_data.name: Creation Chant

ej.notes: These chants are all just bad seek powers unless you're actually in all 3 of it's colors. In that case, it's a seek power that you can use for a powerful replacement card later on in the game which is pretty fantastic.

card_data.description: Flying, Pledge; Your other Dragons go Berserk and never stop.; Mastery 10: Transform any number of cards in your hand into Dragons.
card_data.name: Skylord Tolek

ej.notes: Hard to cast flying 5/5 with pledge is usually going to be pretty great. The mastery also has reasonable potential to be great.

card_data.description: Pledge; Enemy units without battle skills can't block.; Mastery 10: Zadia gets all battle skills.
card_data.name: Zadia, Revered Outcast

ej.notes: The chances that Zadia can punch through despite any evasion is a reasonable proposition. Proccing her mastery turns her into a game-winning threat.

card_data.description: Charge, Endurance, Exalted, Pledge; When a relic goes to your void, play a random Sigil from your deck.; Mastery 10: +Attack/+Health equal to your Armor.
card_data.name: Naoki, Valiant Warrior

ej.notes: This is a solid unit that's hard to cast. The mastery will rarely be relevant, but all 4 of it's keywords are pretty great.

card_data.description: Give one of your units and each of your units that share a type with it +1/+1.
card_data.name: Unity Within

ej.notes: Slow speed and too much set up for my tastes, but has the potential to be a reasonable buff in a tribal deck like strangers.

card_data.description: Flying; Your spells deal +1 damage.; Mastery 3: Your spells deal an additional +1 damage.
card_data.name: Double Helix Drake

ej.notes: Baseline is pretty bad here, but goes up significantly in a dedicated spell damage deck.

card_data.description: Flying
card_data.name: Brood of Eremot

ej.notes: Solid evasive threat, but a bit restrictive with the influence requirement.

card_data.description: Flying, Quickdraw; Your spells and curses can't be negated or stopped by Aegis.; Tribute: Invoke {S}.
card_data.name: Aurapiercer

ej.notes: This is a real air beater. The quickdraw means it can basically just attack freely every single turn. The tribute is not difficult to enable in shadow generally and especially in this format, so it will often replace itself with an invoked card when played as well. The triple influence is the only downside here, but even if shadow is cut heavy throughout your draft I'd probably prioritize a ton of shadow fixing to splash this guy regardless of anything.

card_data.description: Flying, Overwhelm; When you draw a power card, create and draw a Treasure Trove.; When you play a spell, Midias gets +Attack equal to the cost of that spell this turn.
card_data.name: Midias, Leyline Dragon

ej.notes: Large evasive threat combined with excellent card advantage and an additional ability that works well with its Overwhelm. This seems like a real bomb to me.

card_data.description: Give one of your units Revenge. Then give a unit, weapon, or spell in your hand Revenge.
card_data.name: Touch of Resilience

ej.notes: I still don't actually know if this really gives relic weapons the kind of revenge I am thinking of, but either way revenge is a mechanic that can be good or bad depending on if it ever actually does anything. Relic weapons coming out on a turn where they have nothing to kill and are stonewalled by a large unit or something is not great. If you can give revenge to a real removal spell the value goes up quite a bit, but this is such a situational and random card due to the nature of revenge I'm hard-pressed to rate this any higher.

card_data.description: Flying, Deadly, Killer, Lifesteal; Spellcraft 6: Play The Witching Hour.
card_data.name: Pale Rider's Timepiece

ej.notes: This weapon will upgrade any unit into a win condition, but at a huge influence cost. For 12 power, it will basically win you the game. I'd really try and play this in any base shadow deck, but unfortunately the quad shadow makes this nigh impossible to splash otherwise.

card_data.description: At the end of the cursed player's turn, deal 1 damage to them and gain 1 Health.; When you sacrifice a unit, increase this ability by 1.
card_data.name: Mysterious Waystone

ej.notes: Can basically be a do-nothing relic, but in the right deck can be a real win-con. Build around card.

card_data.description: Ambush; Unblockable while attacking sites.; Ultimate: Pay 5 to draw a card of your choice from the enemy player's Market.
card_data.name: Damara, Deft Saboteur

ej.notes: Reasonable stats for the cost and ambush means it can probably just trade up when played. I don't really expect any of the other text to ever be relevant.

card_data.description: Summon: Silence and kill a multifaction enemy unit.; Corrupted 5
card_data.name: Purgedriver

ej.notes: I just don't think there's enough targets for this guy to be great in draft. Hard to cast situational removal on a stick.

card_data.description: Once per turn, you may pay 2 to stun an enemy unit, draw a card, or give each of your units +1/+1 this turn.
card_data.name: Sorcerer's Wand

ej.notes: In a very controlling deck, this card basically does it all. The floor is pretty low though as this can basically be a relic that is expensive and does nothing, but just don't jam this into literally any deck playing Tradition and you'll probably be a happy camper.

card_data.description: Summon: Double Edge of Prophecy's Attack/ Armor.
card_data.name: Edge of Prophecy

ej.notes: Restrictive influence, but at it's worst is an undercosted improvised club. Gets pretty busted with void recursion and buffs of any kind. Real upside potential in the right deck and already playable without any additional synergy.

card_data.description: Pledge; At the end of your turn, if you have no cards in your hand, draw Bhodi & Rox from your deck.
card_data.name: Bhodi & Rox

ej.notes: Best Bhodi available in the format and most pun-friendly name. This does not bode well for your opponent when you have this unit on 7 and it randomly self tutors when you manage to dump your hand out. This card rocks my socks.

card_data.description: {T}{T}{S}{S}: At the end of your turn, if you have 4 or more remaining power, play Endless Nightmare from your void.; Endless Nightmare can't block.
card_data.name: Endless Nightmare

ej.notes: Even in a sac deck, passing your turn with 4 power open just to get this guy back out that can't even block is not very exciting to me.

card_data.description: Deadly; Summon: The enemy player discards the top two cards of their deck.; Corrupted 2
card_data.name: Two-Face

ej.notes: Expensive Direfang Spider.

card_data.description: When you draw a card, Yeti Cookmaster gets +2 Attack this turn.
card_data.name: Yeti Cookmaster

ej.notes: 3/1 for 2 on your turn. 1/1 on opponent's turn. Basically an aggressive unit never let you trade up on defense. Expect to trade when attacking with a 1/1 token of some kind. Medium rare, please.

card_data.description: When the cursed player plays a unit, play a -1 Attack curse on it.; At the end of their turn, play a 1-cost unit from your deck, then increase this ability by 1.
card_data.name: Restrained Action

ej.notes: For the cost, it might already be too late for this to really be relevant, but there will be enough games where this represents some Kodosh Sees All style inevitability that I'm actually pretty excited to try it out. This art is pretty funny as well; "I'm gonna stab 'em, but just a little bit." Nice and restrained indeed.

card_data.description: Give one of your units +1 Attack, Flying, and Lifesteal.; At the end of the turn, sacrifice it.
card_data.name: Contaminating Ritual

ej.notes: The baseline is pretty bad here, but there is some real value in a deck with tons of sacrifice synergy and/or void recursion. Build-around for sure.

card_data.description: Sacrifice Bookclub Yeti to deal damage to an enemy unit equal to the highest cost among your relics.
card_data.name: Bookclub Yeti

ej.notes: Another Pyre Adept with upside. Ability to use as a situational removal spell is pretty nice, but the set up required means it will usually just be a primal Pyre Adept that trades in combat.

card_data.description: Summon: Transform each of your other units into random units that cost 1 more.; Corrupted 8
card_data.name: Vernal Mandrake

ej.notes: This is a card that's great on it's own, but also has a massively powerful summon effect tacked on that works even better the second time. The only reason it's not a straight A is the triple primal influence.

card_data.description: Give one of your units Lifesteal. Then give a unit, weapon, or spell in your hand Lifesteal.
card_data.name: Touch of Purity

ej.notes: Lifesteal is usually a pretty good ability in draft, helping you win the overall race to the finish, but won't actually help you win combat or anything like that.

card_data.description: Give one of your units Double Damage. Then give a unit, weapon, or spell in your hand Double Damage.
card_data.name: Touch of Force

ej.notes: Fast speed double damage with a second *anything* in hand also getting the buff. SeemsGood and doesn't require too much set up

card_data.description: Put a unit or relic with cost 3 or less into its owner's hand.; You gain 3 Health.
card_data.name: Pause for Reflection

ej.notes: Situational, cheaper teleport. Can be used to blow out some opposing fast spells or kill a weapon on a unit, but the cost requirement brings it down quite a bit for me. Your deck having solid summon effects on 2/3 drops brings the value up quite a bit (e.g. multiple rectifiers).

card_data.description: Warcry; Summon: +2 Attack this turn.; Fate: You gain 1 Armor.
card_data.name: Xultan Arbalest

ej.notes: Slightly lower statted, but lower costed Rampart Arbalest. Potential to 2 for 1 is best case, but at worst can still remove an x/3.

card_data.description: When you deal damage, play a 2/2 Oni Grunt.
card_data.name: Shugo's Hooked Sword

ej.notes: Expensive, but will kill basically anything for it's cost. Weapon recursion and spell damage means bonus value synergy for the cost, but does require some set up. Replaces itself with a 2/2 which is not that exciting.

card_data.description: When you play a relic, stun an enemy unit.
card_data.name: Frostbite Chrysalis

ej.notes: Now this is a solid pay off for spamming relics. Serviceable body with upside.

card_data.description: Flying; When you play a relic, you gain an Aegis.
card_data.name: Forlorn Gryffyn

ej.notes: Unimpressive body with evasion. Situational face aegis not that exciting in draft, but can be relevant.

card_data.description: At the end of your turn, draw a card for each Totemite you played this turn. ; Tribute: Put five 2/2 Tough Tota into the top ten cards of your deck.
card_data.name: Tota Circle

ej.notes: You can reasonably expect to draw into these totemites, but because the draw happens at the end of your turn, each turn where you draw one of the 2/2's will not be very exciting. Seems playable, but too slow to be great on its own. The grade goes way up with other playable tota in your deck, but there really aren't that many.

card_data.description: Flying, Reckless; Mastery 9: Create and draw three Treasure Troves.
card_data.name: Burningcore Drake

ej.notes: Harder to cast Skysnapper with upside

card_data.description: Flying; +2 Attack for each Treasure Trove in your void.; Pay 8 to deal 1 damage for each different name among your Dragons.
card_data.name: Razorpain Hellkite

ej.notes: Restrictive influence, but real stats on an evasive unit with upside.

card_data.description: Flying, Pledge; When you draw your second card in a turn, play a 2/2 Oni Grunt.
card_data.name: Tattoo Dragon

ej.notes: Solid stats on an evasive beater with token generating capabilities. You're not going to be very hapy pledging this one, but it's nice to know you can.

card_data.description: Exhaust Kindling Carver and sacrifice another unit to draw a card and reduce its cost by 1 this turn. At the end of your turn, discard it.
card_data.name: Kindling Carver

ej.notes: Seems decent when built around

card_data.description: Summon: Play a 0/1 Totemite. If you have ten or more units in your void, play an 8/8 Giant instead. ; Corrupted 1
card_data.name: Kato, Arena Herald

ej.notes: Summon ability helps reach the unit threshold, but ideally this is really a cheap "7 drop". Playable without any real synergies, but in a deck with a lot of sac fodder and corrupted units, the pay off is within reach. 1 cost on the corrupted ability is bonkers.
